title: Chicago mayor's office response to encampments

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Chicago mayor's office response to encampments
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Any directive, policy memo, or other written guidance sent after April 18, 2024 from the office of Mayor Brandon Johnson to Chicago Police Superintendent Larry Snelling concerning CPD's potential response to Gaza solidarity encampments at Chicago colleges and universities.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rebecca Burns

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Untitled
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

1) Incident reports, police narratives, and any other documentation pertaining to CPD's response and arrest of 68 demonstrators at the School of the Art Institute of Chicago on May 4, 2024.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rebecca Burns
